text: Abraham Clark (February 15, 1725 â€“ September 15, 1794) was an American politician and Revolutionary War figure. He was delegate for New Jersey to the Continental Congress where he signed the Declaration of Independence and later served in the United States House of Representatives in both the Second and Third United States Congress, from March 4, 1791, until his death in 1794. Category:1725 births Category:1794 deaths Category:Signers of the U.S. Declaration of Independence Category:United States representatives from New Jersey
title: Abraham Clark
